Description: National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) urbanization code. 1 refers to a large, central metro county and 6 refers to a rural county.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics
United States Census Bureau
United States Census Bureau

Description: Percent of the population identifying as Hispanic.
Source: United States Census Bureau ACS 5-year Estimates
United States Census Bureau ACS 5-year Estimates

Description: The GINI index is a measure of income inequality. According to the US Census Bureau, "The Gini coefficient ranges from 0, indicating perfect equality (where everyone receives an equal share), to 1, perfect inequality (where only one recipient or group of recipients receives all the income)."
Source: United States Census Bureau ACS 5-year Estimates

Description: Percent of the labor force that the Bureau of Labor Statistics defines as unemployed. See link for definitions.
Source: Unisted States Bureau of Labor Statistics

Description: Percent of the adult population that does not have health insurance.

Description: Number of opioid prescriptions filled per 100 people. From the CDC: "For this database, a prescription is a new or refill prescription dispensed at a retail pharmacy in the sample and paid for by commercial insurance, Medicaid, Medicare, cash or its equivalent, and other third-party coverage. This database does not include mail order prescriptions."
Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
